Less than three months after
opening day, the Worlds Fair
announced that it is paying off
almost $7,500,000 on its debt.
This payments being made two
years before it is due, and repre-
sents one-fourth of the total
500, 100000 financing that built
the Fair. The early prepayment
was made possible by the tre-
mendous advance sale of admis-
sion tickets.

NEW YORK, The Ford Foun-
dation has announced a 100000
appropriation to permit the rapid
mobilization Of scholars to
study the economic conse-
quences of large-scale, fast
striking, unpredictable events In
the domestic economy, such as
natural disaster or major
changes in national economic
policy. The program Is intended
to help capture important econo-
insights knowledge Of the re-
covery process. for example
usually lost to scholars due to the
lack of immediate research
funds.


Other actions announced by the
foundation included:


A 100000 appropriation for
further support to basic research
on the factors responsible for
economic growth and


A grant of 10000 to the
National Industrial Conference
Board to study the employment OF
Negroes in business and industry.

lurge you to review your pur-
chases within the last year and
read your manufacturers guar
antees. Depending on the type of
merchandise, warranty or
guarantee expires from 80 days to
year. Some of the finer print
gives you a shorter time on GER
tain parts.


While cleaning out our file
cabinet l opened the guarantee
folder and found several interest
ing cards or papers of written
guarantee.


The first one studied covered
a glass lined gas water heater
which was installed in 1860. This
heater replaced defective heat
which had been originally pur-
chased in 1853. The initial
purchase was guaranteed for ten
years and | saved the card after
mailing in the bottom part. The
plumbing company which had in
stalled 1t first said the guaran-
tee was past when l called to
report that the heater had br oxen.


After producing not only the
guarantee but the sales receipt,
a new heater was installed. There
was one difficulty = the heater
of the same model we're no longer
in stock and we had to pay slight
charge of twelve dollars for an
other one.


If you have any guarantees
handy, study them and become
acquainted with the finer prints.
A few of them seem to be all
fine prints and some of the terms
an attorney would be needed to
decipher.


l discovered a guarantee for
some articles which we pur-
chased but we cannot recall
where, when or what 1t Is.


The guarantee is for five years.
1t further states that the finest
materials obtainable have been
used in making this article. This
guarantee was filed but | failed
to fill out the purchase date or
kind of article. Here stand
with perfectly bona fide guaran-
tee without knowing what Is
guaranteed.


Some firms issue warranties
while other use guarantees. Both
agreements state that the article
is made of quality materials
(Which grade is often dubious).
The manufacturer agrees to re-
place the article within a GER
tain time If parts or the entire
article Is defective.


One Of the shortest guarantees
| have ever seen was for three
months.


Save your guaranty, save your
warranty, you never know when
you might need it. If anyone
needs Race guarantee have an
extra one.


EIlNNe Tn Ain

Thousands of school doors opened all 0veT
the state during the past tho weeks. More
students of all ages, ranging from the kinder
guyten to the university haze registered than
ever before. Elementary schools, high schoo
and the colleges are literally bursting at the
seams with bYosbe ctiUe learners.


Reports from leading educational book
publishing firms state that textbook sales
are higher than at any time in the nations
history.


With increased emphasis ON providing
more education for more persons the next
decade mil present more pressing problems
in raising school revenues and building and
maintaining adequate school facilities.


There are many problems taci'ag citizens
and taxpayers in Arizona, but one Of the
greatest burdens is financing our local
schools. our school population uiH con-
tinue to grow and educational opportunities
must be extended to all.


At the next legis l0ttve session, the U0ices
of the taxpayers should be heard by those
elected at the state capitol. DO not permit
our legis latoYs forget that back to school
means UP the school costs.

Ice cream and other frozen
foods are holding their reputation
as Americas favorite desserts.
Consumption Of these products
climbed to record level of 2l.l
quarts per person In 1868.
Present ice cream consumption
is more than double the per
capita rate of Is years ago.

leadership I'm the financial world. Last year
1T NON blaudits of the advertising groups in the
west for using faces of students of different
races in its statewide advertising program.

several shop uindOws and in clasSToonas.


This past year has been quiet, working
year at Valley National Bank where several
persons of diverse racial groups haze been
Employed and trained.


On Monday, Sept. IA, the first Negro teller
in the Phoenix area, mill perform his duties
at the recently completed VNB branch located
at 10th St. and Buckeye Road.

viding greater mbloynaemt OPPORTUNITIES for
